intro: Boechera spatifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera spatifolia is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
